alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 10:01AM PST until January 08 at 5:05PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Washington... Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River At Centralia affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. Chehalis River At Centralia affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston Counties. .Little rain is in the forecast for the weekend. The Chehalis River continues to rise due to heavy rainfall the previous two days. All other rivers continue to recede. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...The river will continue to recede. * WHERE...Skookumchuck River At Centralia. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 187.0 feet, the Skookumchuck River in Lewis county will spill into low areas along the river near Centralia. This river level on the Skookumchuck corresponds roughly to a Phase 1 flood in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM PST Saturday the stage was 188.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling for the remainder of the weekend. - Flood stage is 189.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1100 AM PST.
